keyMoments.title: Koza's Debut as Rebel Leader
keyMoments.description: Koza appears for the first time at the rebel base in Katorea, discussing plans with his followers and declaring his intent to change Arabasta through the rebellion.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the leader of the rebellion against King Cobra. Establishes Koza as a determined, passionate leader fighting for what he believes is right, though he is being manipulated by Baroque Works.

relationships.description: Koza and Vivi were childhood friends. He was the leader of the Sand-Sand Clan and named Vivi as deputy leader.

evolutionMoments.description: Koza is introduced as the rebel leader, though his connection to Vivi is not yet revealed.

reveals.information: Leader of the Arabasta Rebellion with nearly two million warriors
Intent to change Arabasta through rebellion against King Cobra

keyMoments.title: Matsuge Helps Chopper Escape
keyMoments.description: Matsuge, a camel with distinctive long eyelashes, discovers Chopper at the rebel base and helps him escape back to Nanohana. The camel is transporting weapons for the rebels.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces Matsuge in an anime-original scene, establishing his helpful nature and connection to Chopper earlier than in the manga. Sets up his role as the crew's desert transportation.

relationships.description: Matsuge befriends Chopper after helping him escape from the rebel base.

evolutionMoments.description: Matsuge finds Chopper at Katorea and helps him return to Nanohana.

reveals.information: Camel with notably long bottom eyelashes
Transports weapons between Nanohana and Katorea for the rebels

keyMoments.title: Kamonegi the Smuggler Appears
keyMoments.description: Kamonegi is introduced as a smuggler in Nanohana who possesses a hidden stash of Dance Powder, which he plans to sell for profit during the drought.
keyMoments.significance: Anime-only character who serves as the vehicle for explaining Dance Powder to Luffy and the audience.

keyMoments.title: Explains Dance Powder
keyMoments.description: After Luffy defeats him, Kamonegi explains what Dance Powder is and how it works, revealing its connection to Arabasta's drought and rebellion.
keyMoments.significance: Provides crucial exposition about the conspiracy affecting Arabasta.
keyMoments.quote: That green powder is called Dance Powder, also known as Rain-Calling Powder. It goes through a complicated process to artificially make rainfall.

reveals.information: Dance Powder smuggler planning to profit from the drought

keyMoments.title: Discovers Dance Powder
keyMoments.description: Luffy stumbles upon Kamonegi's Dance Powder stash while looking for food, leading to his discovery of the substance central to Arabasta's conspiracy.
keyMoments.significance: Luffy's accidental discovery helps him begin to understand the complexity of Arabasta's problems.

keyMoments.title: Burns Dance Powder
keyMoments.description: Disliking the taste, Luffy burns the Dance Powder, accidentally demonstrating how it creates artificial rain.
keyMoments.significance: Visually demonstrates the powder's effects and triggers the confrontation with Kamonegi.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Accidentally Goes to Katorea
keyMoments.description: Exhausted by the desert heat, Chopper falls asleep in a truck that transports him to the rebel base, where he witnesses Koza and the rebel army.
keyMoments.significance: Anime-original scene that gives Chopper intelligence about the rebellion and introduces him to Matsuge.

keyMoments.title: Befriends Matsuge
keyMoments.description: Matsuge helps Chopper escape from the rebel base, establishing their friendship.
keyMoments.significance: Creates an early bond between Chopper and the camel who will help the crew through the desert.

relationships.description: Chopper befriends Matsuge after the camel helps him escape from Katorea.

evolutionMoments.description: Matsuge discovers Chopper at the rebel base and helps him return to Nanohana.

keyMoments.title: Hides Identity in Nanohana
keyMoments.description: Vivi must hide under a blanket with Karoo to avoid being recognized by the citizens of Nanohana, showing the danger she faces in her own kingdom.
keyMoments.significance: Emphasizes how divided Arabasta has become and the risk Vivi takes by returning home.

relationships.description: Vivi and Koza were childhood friends, though this connection is not revealed in this episode.

evolutionMoments.description: Koza appears as the rebel leader, but his friendship with Vivi is not yet known to the audience.
